page.title: 08THE WHITE HORSE PUB
page.content: The landlord of the White Horse Pub has worked there 7 years and he is a Londoner. He said that he gets local customers and passing travellers. The White Horse Pub is on the road going between Colchester and Tiptree. {Forge Cottages} Originally it was 4 cottages, then 2, now 1 dwelling. Mr.Hunnabal bought it 17 years ago. His neighbour died 14 years ago so Mr.Hunnabal bought his house and made it into one dwelling. There is a brick shed on the roadside which is thought to be the original forge. People travelled from London to Layer Marney Towers and the horses were shod at the forge. Built in the wall of the shed is a Victorian letterbox. { Smythe's Green } Smythe's Green is about 2 acres of common land.It is not used by anybody.
